content:
ObjectSecurity<T> Class

Definition

Provides the ability to control access to objects without direct manipulation of Access Control Lists (ACLs); also grants the ability to type-cast access rights.

In this Article

public abstract class ObjectSecurity<T> : System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity where T : struct

Type Parameters

T

The access rights for the object.
Inheritance
Object
ObjectSecurity
CommonObjectSecurity
NativeObjectSecurity

Remarks

Access rights (permissions) are type T, which you can type-cast to or from an int. For example, you can cast a FileSystemRights as the access rights type, and then use the instance normally. In contrast, ObjectSecurity always takes access rights of type int.

RemoveAccessRule(AccessRule<T>)

Removes access rules that contain the same security identifier and access mask as the specified access rule from the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with this ObjectSecurity`1 object.

public virtual bool RemoveAccessRule (System.Security.AccessControl.AccessRule<T> rule);
Parameters
rule
AccessRule<T>

The rule to remove.

Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the access rule was successfully removed; otherwise, false.

rule
